item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, March 17, 2025 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Launching RDAP; sunsetting WHOIS (712 points | 283 comments)
2. Ogres Are Cool (45 points | 11 comments)
3. Chaos in the Cloudflare Lisbon Office (51 points | 13 comments)
4. Docs – Open source alternative to Notion or Outline (1682 points | 424 comments)

6. Raspberry Pi RP2350 Now Available for Purchase, Stacked Memory Variant Coming (76 points | 26 comments)

8. Extracting content from an LCP "protected" ePub (37 points | 7 comments)
9. Compression of Spectral Images Using Spectral JPEG XL (56 points | 8 comments)
10. Show HN: A bi-directional, persisted KV store that is faster than Redis (25 points | 33 comments)
11. HTTP/3 is everywhere but nowhere (189 points | 166 comments)
12. Undergraduate Disproves 40-Year-Old Conjecture, Invents New Kind of Hash Table (62 points | 23 comments)
13. Nango (YC W23, Product Integrations Platform) Is Hiring Remote Engineers ( | hide)
14. Conducting forensics of mobile devices to find signs of a potential compromise (112 points | 20 comments)
15. Recommendations for designing magic numbers of binary file formats (98 points | 20 comments)
16. Going down the rabbit hole of Git's new bundle-URI (249 points | 81 comments)
17. Converting C to ASM to specs and then to a working Z/80 Speccy tape (57 points | 59 comments)
18. Genomic study: our capacity for language emerged at least 135k years ago (60 points | 34 comments)
19. The Alexa feature "do not send voice recordings" you enabled no longer available (717 points | 475 comments)
20. Checkers written in Rust and exported to WASM (78 points | 31 comments)
21. Image Processing in C – Dwayne Phillips [pdf] (101 points | 17 comments)
22. Take a New Look at CSS Shapes (2018) (3 points | discuss)
23. Akira ransomware can be cracked with sixteen RTX 4090 GPUs in around ten hours (53 points | 14 comments)
24. Zlib-rs is faster than C (292 points | 396 comments)
25. Did the Particle Go Through the Two Slits, or Did the Wave Function? (185 points | 243 comments)
26. Teach, Don't Tell (2013) (184 points | 58 comments)
27. When the Dotcom Bubble Burst (235 points | 243 comments)
28. Artificial photosynthesis directed toward organic synthesis (55 points | 12 comments)
29. That Time I Recreated Photoshop in C++ (275 points | 125 comments)
30. Underware 2.0 – Open Source Infinite Cable Management (14 points | 3 comments)
